egl.math

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • egl.math.Color

  • public class Color
extends java.lang.Object
    An RGBA color, stored internally as 4 bytes.
    Author:
    Cristian, eschweic

      • Color

        public Color(byte r,
     byte g,
     byte b)
        Construct a color, specifying its components as bytes. The alpha value is assumed to be 255.

        g - The green component.
        b - The blue component.

      • set

        public Color set(Colorf cf)
        Set this color to the values of a given Colorf. Values from the input Colorf are clamped between 0.0f and 1.0f before being mapped to a [0,255] range.
        Parameters:
        cf - The reference color.
        Returns:
        this.

      • set

        public Color set(Colord cd)
        Set this color to the values of a given Colord. Values from the input Colord are clamped between 0.0 and 1.0 before being mapped to a [0,255] range.
        Parameters:
        cf - The reference color.
        Returns:
        this.

        public Color set(Color c)
        Copy a given Color's components to this Color.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this.

      • r

        public int r()
        Get the red component in the range [0, 255].
        Returns:
        the red component.

        the blue component.

      • a

        public int a()
        Get the alpha component in the range [0, 255].
        Returns:
        the alpha component.

      • toIntRGB

        public int toIntRGB()
        This function returns an int which represents this color. The standard RGB style bit packing is used and is compatible with java.awt.BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB. (ie - the low 8 bits, 0-7 are for the blue channel, the next 8 are for the green channel, and the next 8 are for the red channel). The highest 8 bits are left untouched.
        Returns:
        An integer representing this color.

      • fromIntRGB

        public static Color fromIntRGB(int rgb)
        This function returns a Color from a integer of the form java.awt.BufferedImage.[TYPE_INT_RGB, TYPE_INT_ARGB]. In the latter case, the alpha value is ignored; the alpha is always set to 255.
        Parameters:
        rgb - An integer representing a color.
        Returns:
        A Color object representing the input integer.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
